config_description: default options for full query logging - these can be overridden from command line when executing nodetool enablefullquerylog
developer_understanding_on_working: The full_query_logging_options configuration in the code provides default options for full query logging. The getFullQueryLoggerOptions method retrieves the options if logging is enabled, otherwise it gets the options from the cassandra.yaml file. The enableFullQueryLogger method allows for overriding these options with parameters provided.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the full_query_logging_options configuration depends on when the enableFullQueryLogger method is called with new parameters to override the default options. This can vary depending on how often the method is invoked in the system.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the full_query_logging_options configuration option on the system is related to the amount of data being logged and stored. Changing the log directory, log size, archive command, and other options can affect the system's performance and resource usage, especially if large amounts of queries are being logged.
